headline.main: Waking Up to Major Colonoscopy Bills
headline.print_headline: The Consumer: Waking Up to Major Colonoscopy Bills

docs.abstract: Prices for colonoscopy are far higher than they should be, some experts say, in part because of rising charges for anesthesia.
docs.snippet: Prices for colonoscopy are far higher than they should be, some experts say, in part because of rising charges for anesthesia.

headline.main: When Costly Medical Care Just Adds to the Pain
headline.print_headline: Personal Health: Trimming a Bloated Health Care System

docs.abstract: Expectations and demands of health care must change, and the incentives for tremendous waste must be reckoned with.
docs.snippet: Expectations and demands of health care must change, and the incentives for tremendous waste must be reckoned with.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a dramatic stunt, some Catholic groups have filed lawsuits claiming that President Obama has violated their religious freedom by including contraceptives in health care coverage.
docs.abstract: Editorial contends that the lawsuits filed by Catholic groups across the country claiming that Pres Obama has violated their religious freedom by including contraceptives in basic health care coverage for female employees are dramatic stunts and nothing more.
docs.snippet: In a dramatic stunt, some Catholic groups have filed lawsuits claiming that President Obama has violated their religious freedom by including contraceptives in health care coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE sleek, four-armed ''da Vinci'' robot has been called a breakthrough technology for procedures like prostate surgery. ''Imagine,'' the manufacturer says, ''having the benefits of a definitive treatment but with the potential for significantly less pain, a shorter hospital stay, faster return to normal daily activities.'' That's just the kind of impressive-sounding innovation that critics of the health care reform act say will be stifled by the new law, with its emphasis on cost control and the comparative effectiveness of new pills and devices. ''Instead of encouraging innovation,'' wrote Senator Ron Johnson, Republican of Wisconsin, in The Wall Street Journal, ''it stifles creativity.''

headline.main: Op-Ed Contributor: In Medicine, Falling for Fake Innovation

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by oncologist Ezekiel J Emanuel warns that new medical technology is often confused with innovation, despite the fact that new technologies can often increase medical costs without significantly improving patients' health; contends that critics of the health care reform law who say that it will stifle innovation are incorrect, as the law contains incentives for innovations that are effective. (M)

headline.main: In Medicine, Falling for Fake Innovation
headline.print_headline: Op-Ed Contributor: In Medicine, Falling for Fake Innovation

docs.abstract: We need to stop glorifying every new technology as an innovation. New matters only when it's proved better than what we had before.
docs.snippet: We need to stop glorifying every new technology as an innovation. New matters only when it's proved better than what we had before.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama has quite a record of accomplishment to run on for re-election if he would only run on it.

headline.seo: President Obama Should Seize the High Ground
headline.main: Obama Should Seize the High Ground
headline.print_headline: Obama Should Seize the High Ground

docs.abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column laments that Pres Obama is campaigning on poll-tested wedge issues rather than his very real accomplishments; urges him to campaign on a comprehensive plan for stimulus and deficit reduction.
docs.snippet: President Obama has quite a record of accomplishment to run on for re-election if he would only run on it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Criminals filing false tax returns with made-up incomes have received hundreds of millions of dollars in refunds, law enforcement officials say.

headline.main: With Personal Data in Hand, Thieves File Early and Often
headline.print_headline: ID Thieves Loot Tax Checks, Filing Early and Often

docs.abstract: Criminals are electronically filing thousands of false tax returns with made-up incomes and withholding information, and have received hundreds of millions of dollars in wrongful refunds; they outwit the Internal Revenue Service by filing a return and claiming a refund on a hard-to-trace prepaid debit card before the legitimate taxpayer files; the fraud, which has spread around the country, is costing taxpayers hundreds of millions of dollars annually,
docs.snippet: Criminals filing false tax returns with made-up incomes have received hundreds of millions of dollars in refunds, law enforcement officials say.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ina May Gaskin, the original home-birth evangelist, is finally winning converts in the mainstream.

headline.seo: Ina May Gaskin and the Battle for at-Home Births

docs.abstract: Samantha M Shapiro article chronicles Ina May Gaskin, who may be the most prominent figure in the crusade to expand access to, and to legalize, midwife-assisted homebirth, and who is finally winning converts in the medical community after years of advocacy; describes her own experience of attempting to give birth assisted by a midwife, which ultimately ended in a Caesarean section procedure.
docs.snippet: Ina May Gaskin, the original home-birth evangelist, is finally winning converts in the mainstream.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lauren Elizabeth Belive and Jeffrey Ryan Zubricki are to be married Sunday evening at the Wequassett Resort and Golf Club in Chatham, Mass. The Rev. James F. David, a priest with the Ecumenical Catholic Diocese of America, is to perform the ceremony. The bride, 28, will keep her name. She works in Washington as an associate counsel for the Democratic staff of the House Rules Committee, helping bring legislation to the House floor. Until last month, she was a legislative assistant in the White House. She graduated from Barnard College.
docs.snippet: The couple, who work for Congressional committees, are to be married in Massachusetts.
